required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect Of Dose Titration And Dose Tapering On The Tolerability Of DVS SR In Women With Vasomotor Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Dose Titration and Dose Tapering on the Tolerability of DVS SR in Women With Vasomotor Symptoms Associated With Menopause: The PRIMMUS (PRIstiq for Managing Menopause and Understanding Symptoms) Study

brief_summary.textblock: Desvenlafaxine succinate (DVS SR) is a serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI). It is a nonhormonal option for the treatment of Vasomotor Symptoms (VMS) associated with menopause. Nausea is the most common adverse event that is observed in clinical studies and is the main reason for discontinuation during the first week of therapy. Other adverse events (headache, nausea, and dizziness) associated with DVS SR have been noted to occur when subjects abruptly discontinue the medication. The purpose of this study is to evaluate several titration and tapering regimens of DVS SR to ensure a better tolerability profile at the start and completion of treatment. In addition, this study will provide a long posttreatment follow-up to assess any symptoms after treatment is discontinued.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Nausea During the First 2 Weeks of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Nausea by spontaneous reports to the investigators was counted if it was reported during first 2 weeks of treatment, and it was not seen before the first dose of treatment, or if it was seen before the first dose and the symptoms got worse. If multiple incidences occurred on the same participant during the 2 weeks, only 1 incidence was counted.

primary_outcome.measure: Discontinuation Emergent Signs and Symptoms (DESS) Total Score at the End of First Week of Tapering
primary_outcome.description: DESS: a clinician-administered 43-item assessment that evaluates discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from the withdrawal from test article. The DESS total score is the sum of the number of "new symptoms" and "old (but worse) symptoms" (1) and 0 for "old and unchanged symptom", "absent", or "old symptom but improved" for a total possible range of 0 to 43. A higher score indicates more symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: DESS Total Score at End of Second Week of Tapering
primary_outcome.description: DESS: a clinician-administered 43-item assessment that evaluates discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from the withdrawal from test article. The DESS total score is the sum of the number of "new symptoms" and "old (but worse) symptoms" (1) and 0 for "old and unchanged symptom", "absent", or "old symptom but improved" for a total possible range of 0 to 43. A higher score indicates more symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: DESS Total Score at 1 Week After the End of Tapering
primary_outcome.description: DESS: a clinician-administered 43-item assessment that evaluates discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from the withdrawal from test article. The DESS total score is the sum of the number of "new symptoms" and "old (but worse) symptoms" (1) and 0 for "old and unchanged symptom", "absent", or "old symptom but improved" for a total possible range of 0 to 43. A higher score indicates more symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Other Spontaneously Reported Adverse Events (AEs) in First 2 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug was considered an AE, without regard to possibility of causal relationship.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Discontinuing Treatment Due to AEs in First 2 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug was considered an AE, without regard to possibility of causal relationship.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Each DESS at the End of First Week of Tapering
secondary_outcome.description: DESS: a clinician-administered 43-item assessment that evaluates discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from the withdrawal from test article.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Each DESS at the End of Second Week of Tapering
secondary_outcome.description: DESS: a clinician-administered 43-item assessment that evaluates discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from the withdrawal from test article.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Each DESS One Week After End of Tapering
secondary_outcome.description: DESS: a clinician-administered 43-item assessment that evaluates discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from the withdrawal from test article.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Showing Satisfaction With Tolerability During the First Two Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Satisfaction with tolerability (lack of bothersomeness) was assessed using a questionnaire via an interactive voice response system (IVRS)/interactive web based response system (IWRS), and evaluated based on participants' response of extremely satisfied, satisfied, neutral, dissatisfied or extremely dissatisfied with the study medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Showing Satisfaction With Tolerability at the End of Tapering
secondary_outcome.description: Satisfaction with tolerability (lack of bothersomeness) was assessed using a questionnaire via an IVRS/IWRS and evaluated based on participants' response of extremely satisfied, satisfied, neutral, dissatisfied or extremely dissatisfied with the study medication.

MS-TSQ is a questionnaire assessing participants' degree of satisfaction with regard to the test article which was administered to the participants via an IVRS/IWRS. The questionnaire comprised 8 questions and each was rated on a scale from 0 (extremely dissatisfied) to 4 (extremely satisfied).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Menopause-specific Quality of Life Questionnaire (MenQOL) Score at Week 4, Week 8, Week 12 and Week 16
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12 and Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: MenQOL questionnaire assessed how bothered participants were with 31 symptoms. It contains domains: vasomotor (items 1-3); psychosocial (items 4-10); physical (items 11-26); sexual (items 27-29); in addition to nausea and indigestion. 31 individual symptoms are rated on a scale of 0 (not at all bothered) to 6 (extremely bothered). Total possible score ranged from 0 to 186. MenQOL summary score was calculated as mean of four domain scores (Physical function, Psychosocial function, Sexual function and Vasomotor function) ranging from 1 to 8, with higher scores indicating worse quality of life.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Generally healthy, postmenopausal woman who seeks treatment for hot flushes.
- Meets 1 of the following: At least 12 months of spontaneous amenorrhea; At least 6 months of spontaneous amenorrhea with serum follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) levels > 40 mIU/mL; At least 6 weeks postsurgical bilateral oophorectomy (with or without hysterectomy). Hysterectomized without bilateral oophorectomy and with serum FSH levels >40 mIU/mL.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of a seizure disorder other than a single childhood febrile seizure.
- History or presence of clinically important hepatic or renal disease or other medical disease.
- Presence or recent history of major depressive disorder, bipolar disorder, psychotic disorder, or generalized anxiety disorder requiring therapy.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 500 participants were randomized to the study, of which 7 were not treated due to other unspecified reasons. A second randomization occurred for the taper phase.

group.title: DVS 25 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: Desvenlafaxine succinate (DVS) 25 milligram (mg) tablet taken orally daily for one week and placebo matched to 100 mg and 50 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week open label (OL) phase.

group.title: DVS 25/50 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: DVS 25 mg tablet taken orally for first 4 days followed by 50 mg for next 3 days for the first week and placebo matched to 100 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week OL phase.

group.title: DVS 50 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: DVS 50 mg tablet taken orally daily for one week and placebo matched to 100 mg and 25 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week OL phase.

group.title: DVS 100 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: DVS 100 mg tablet taken orally daily for one week and placebo matched to 25 mg and 50 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week OL phase.

group.title: DVS 50 mg QOD
group.description: Re-randomized to DVS 50 mg tablet taken orally every other day (QOD) alternating with placebo matched to 50 mg QOD and placebo matched to 25 mg daily for 2 weeks (double blind tapering phase).

group.title: DVS 50/25 mg
group.description: Re-randomized to DVS 50 mg tablet taken orally daily for first week along with placebo matched to 25 mg. For further 1 week, participants received DVS 25 mg tablet orally daily and placebo matched to 50 mg (double blind tapering phase).

group.title: DVS 50 mg/Placebo
group.description: Re-randomized to DVS 50 mg tablet taken orally daily for first week and placebo matched to 25 mg. For further 1 week, participants received placebo matched to 25 mg and 50 mg (double blind tapering phase).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Re-randomized to placebo tablets matched to 25 mg and 50 mg taken orally daily for two weeks (double blind tapering phase).

period.title: Between Titration and Open Label Phase

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Did not enter the open label phase

group.title: DVS 25 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: DVS 25 mg tablet taken orally daily for one week and placebo matched to 100 mg and 50 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week OL phase.

group.title: DVS 25/50 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: DVS 25 mg tablet taken orally for first 4 days followed by 50 mg for next 3 days for the first week and placebo matched to 100 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week OL phase.

group.title: DVS 50 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: DVS 50 mg tablet taken orally daily for one week and placebo matched to 100 mg and 25 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week OL phase.

group.title: DVS 100 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: DVS 100 mg tablet taken orally daily for one week and placebo matched to 25 mg and 50 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week OL phase.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Nausea During the First 2 Weeks of Treatment
outcome.description: Nausea by spontaneous reports to the investigators was counted if it was reported during first 2 weeks of treatment, and it was not seen before the first dose of treatment, or if it was seen before the first dose and the symptoms got worse. If multiple incidences occurred on the same participant during the 2 weeks, only 1 incidence was counted.
outcome.population: The titration population included all randomly assigned participants who had taken at least 1 dose of double-blind test article during the double-blind titration period.

group.title: DVS 25 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: DVS 25 mg tablet taken orally daily for one week and placebo matched to 100 mg and 50 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week OL phase.

group.title: DVS 25/50 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: DVS 25 mg tablet taken orally for first 4 days followed by 50 mg for next 3 days for the first week and placebo matched to 100 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week OL phase.

group.title: DVS 50 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: DVS 50 mg tablet taken orally daily for one week and placebo matched to 100 mg and 25 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week OL phase.

group.title: DVS 100 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: DVS 100 mg tablet taken orally daily for one week and placebo matched to 25 mg and 50 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week OL phase.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Nausea During the First 2 Weeks of Treatment
measure.description: Nausea by spontaneous reports to the investigators was counted if it was reported during first 2 weeks of treatment, and it was not seen before the first dose of treatment, or if it was seen before the first dose and the symptoms got worse. If multiple incidences occurred on the same participant during the 2 weeks, only 1 incidence was counted.
measure.population: The titration population included all randomly assigned participants who had taken at least 1 dose of double-blind test article during the double-blind titration period.

analysis.groups_desc: Overall comparison was made between each titration regimen and the control regimen (100 mg).
analysis.p_value_desc: The analysis was done at a significance level of alpha = 0.05, 2-sided, without any adjustments for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: Discontinuation Emergent Signs and Symptoms (DESS) Total Score at the End of First Week of Tapering
outcome.description: DESS: a clinician-administered 43-item assessment that evaluates discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from the withdrawal from test article. The DESS total score is the sum of the number of "new symptoms" and "old (but worse) symptoms" (1) and 0 for "old and unchanged symptom", "absent", or "old symptom but improved" for a total possible range of 0 to 43. A higher score indicates more symptoms.
outcome.population: The tapering population included all participants who had completed at least 6 weeks of treatment and taken at least 1 dose of double-blind test article during the tapering phase.

group.title: DVS 50 mg QOD
group.description: Re-randomized to DVS 50 mg tablet taken orally QOD alternating with placebo matched to 50 mg QOD and placebo matched to 25 mg daily for 2 weeks (double blind tapering phase).

group.title: DVS 50/25 mg
group.description: Re-randomized to DVS 50 mg tablet taken orally daily for first week along with placebo matched to 25 mg. For further 1 week, participants received DVS 25 mg tablet orally daily and placebo matched to 50 mg (double blind tapering phase).

group.title: DVS 50 mg/Placebo
group.description: Re-randomized to DVS 50 mg tablet taken orally daily for first week and placebo matched to 25 mg. For further 1 week, participants received placebo matched to 25 mg and 50 mg (double blind tapering phase).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Re-randomized to placebo tablets matched to 25 mg and 50 mg taken orally daily for two weeks (double blind tapering phase).

measure.title: Discontinuation Emergent Signs and Symptoms (DESS) Total Score at the End of First Week of Tapering
measure.description: DESS: a clinician-administered 43-item assessment that evaluates discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from the withdrawal from test article. The DESS total score is the sum of the number of "new symptoms" and "old (but worse) symptoms" (1) and 0 for "old and unchanged symptom", "absent", or "old symptom but improved" for a total possible range of 0 to 43. A higher score indicates more symptoms.
measure.population: The tapering population included all participants who had completed at least 6 weeks of treatment and taken at least 1 dose of double-blind test article during the tapering phase.

analysis.groups_desc: For DVS 50 mg QOD, analysis of variance (ANOVA) was used to compare the DESS score between each tapering regimen and the control regimen (no tapering) for the titration population, where treatment was kept as the factor.
analysis.p_value_desc: The analysis was done at a significance level of alpha = 0.05, 2-sided, without any adjustments for multiple comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: For DVS 50/25 mg, ANOVA was used to compare the DESS score between each tapering regimen and the control regimen (no tapering) for the titration population, where treatment was kept as the factor.
analysis.p_value_desc: The analysis was done at a significance level of alpha = 0.05, 2-sided, without any adjustments for multiple comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: For DVS 50 mg/Placebo, ANOVA was used to compare the DESS score between each tapering regimen and the control regimen (no tapering) for the titration population, where treatment was kept as the factor.
analysis.p_value_desc: The analysis was done at a significance level of alpha = 0.05, 2-sided, without any adjustments for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: DESS Total Score at End of Second Week of Tapering
outcome.description: DESS: a clinician-administered 43-item assessment that evaluates discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from the withdrawal from test article. The DESS total score is the sum of the number of "new symptoms" and "old (but worse) symptoms" (1) and 0 for "old and unchanged symptom", "absent", or "old symptom but improved" for a total possible range of 0 to 43. A higher score indicates more symptoms.
outcome.population: Tapering population included all participants who had completed at least 6 weeks of treatment and taken at least 1 dose of double-blind test article during the tapering phase. Here, the 'N' (number of participants analyzed) is signifying those participants who were evaluable for this measure at the specified time point for each group respectively.

outcome.description: Any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug was considered an AE, without regard to possibility of causal relationship.
outcome.population: The titration population included all randomly assigned participants who had taken at least 1 dose of double-blind test article during the double-blind titration period.

measure.description: DESS: a clinician-administered 43-item assessment that evaluates discontinuation-emergent symptoms resulting from the withdrawal from test article.
measure.population: Tapering population included all participants who had completed at least 6 weeks of treatment and taken at least 1 dose of double-blind test article during the tapering phase. Here, the 'N' (number of participants analyzed) is signifying those participants who were evaluable for this measure at the specified time point for each group respectively.

class.title: Problems with speech or speaking clearly
Ringing or noises in the ears
Shortness of breath, gasping for air

outcome.title: Number of Participants Showing Satisfaction With Tolerability During the First Two Weeks of Treatment
outcome.description: Satisfaction with tolerability (lack of bothersomeness) was assessed using a questionnaire via an interactive voice response system (IVRS)/interactive web based response system (IWRS), and evaluated based on participants’ response of extremely satisfied, satisfied, neutral, dissatisfied or extremely dissatisfied with the study medication.
outcome.population: The titration population included all randomly assigned participants who had taken at least 1 dose of double-blind test article during the double-blind titration period. The 'n' is signifying those participants who received study drug and were evaluated for this measure at the time points for each group respectively.

group.title: DVS 25 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: DVS 25 mg tablet taken orally daily for one week and placebo matched to 100 mg and 50 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week OL phase.

group.title: DVS 25/50 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: DVS 25 mg tablet taken orally for first 4 days followed by 50 mg for next 3 days for the first week and placebo matched to 100 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week OL phase.

group.title: DVS 50 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: DVS 50 mg tablet taken orally daily for one week and placebo matched to 100 mg and 25 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week OL phase.

group.title: DVS 100 mg, Then 100 mg
group.description: DVS 100 mg tablet taken orally daily for one week and placebo matched to 25 mg and 50 mg (double blind titration phase); then 100 mg for 15 week OL phase.

measure.title: Number of Participants Showing Satisfaction With Tolerability During the First Two Weeks of Treatment
measure.description: Satisfaction with tolerability (lack of bothersomeness) was assessed using a questionnaire via an interactive voice response system (IVRS)/interactive web based response system (IWRS), and evaluated based on participants’ response of extremely satisfied, satisfied, neutral, dissatisfied or extremely dissatisfied with the study medication.
measure.population: The titration population included all randomly assigned participants who had taken at least 1 dose of double-blind test article during the double-blind titration period. The 'n' is signifying those participants who received study drug and were evaluated for this measure at the time points for each group respectively.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Showing Satisfaction With Tolerability at the End of Tapering
outcome.description: Satisfaction with tolerability (lack of bothersomeness) was assessed using a questionnaire via an IVRS/IWRS and evaluated based on participants’ response of extremely satisfied, satisfied, neutral, dissatisfied or extremely dissatisfied with the study medication.
outcome.population: Tapering population included all participants who had completed at least 6 weeks of treatment and taken at least 1 dose of double-blind test article during the tapering phase. Here, the 'N' (number of participants analyzed) is signifying those participants who were evaluable for this measure at the specified time point for each group respectively.

group.title: DVS 50 mg QOD
group.description: Re-randomized to DVS 50 mg tablet taken orally QOD alternating with placebo matched to 50 mg QOD and placebo matched to 25 mg daily for 2 weeks (double blind tapering phase).

group.title: DVS 50/25 mg
group.description: Re-randomized to DVS 50 mg tablet taken orally daily for first week along with placebo matched to 25 mg. For further 1 week, participants received DVS 25 mg tablet orally daily and placebo matched to 50 mg (double blind tapering phase).

group.title: DVS 50 mg/Placebo
group.description: Re-randomized to DVS 50 mg tablet taken orally daily for first week and placebo matched to 25 mg. For further 1 week, participants received placebo matched to 25 mg and 50 mg (double blind tapering phase).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Re-randomized to placebo tablets matched to 25 mg and 50 mg taken orally daily for two weeks (double blind tapering phase).

measure.title: Number of Participants Showing Satisfaction With Tolerability at the End of Tapering
measure.description: Satisfaction with tolerability (lack of bothersomeness) was assessed using a questionnaire via an IVRS/IWRS and evaluated based on participants’ response of extremely satisfied, satisfied, neutral, dissatisfied or extremely dissatisfied with the study medication.
measure.population: Tapering population included all participants who had completed at least 6 weeks of treatment and taken at least 1 dose of double-blind test article during the tapering phase. Here, the 'N' (number of participants analyzed) is signifying those participants who were evaluable for this measure at the specified time point for each group respectively.

outcome.title: Menopause Symptoms-treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire (MS-TSQ) Score
outcome.description: MS-TSQ is a questionnaire assessing participants’ degree of satisfaction with regard to the test article which was administered to the participants via an IVRS/IWRS. The questionnaire comprised 8 questions and each was rated on a scale from 0 (extremely dissatisfied) to 4 (extremely satisfied).
outcome.population: The OL population included all participants who had taken at least 1 dose of open label test article. Here, the 'N' (number of participants analyzed) is signifying those participants who were evaluable for this measure at the specified time point for each group respectively.

group.title: DVS 100 mg
group.description: DVS 100 mg tablet taken orally daily for 15 weeks (OL phase).

measure.title: Menopause Symptoms-treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire (MS-TSQ) Score
measure.description: MS-TSQ is a questionnaire assessing participants’ degree of satisfaction with regard to the test article which was administered to the participants via an IVRS/IWRS. The questionnaire comprised 8 questions and each was rated on a scale from 0 (extremely dissatisfied) to 4 (extremely satisfied).
measure.population: The OL population included all participants who had taken at least 1 dose of open label test article. Here, the 'N' (number of participants analyzed) is signifying those participants who were evaluable for this measure at the specified time point for each group respectively.

class.title: Ability to control hot flushes during the day
Ability to control hot flushes during the night

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Menopause-specific Quality of Life Questionnaire (MenQOL) Score at Week 4, Week 8, Week 12 and Week 16
outcome.description: MenQOL questionnaire assessed how bothered participants were with 31 symptoms. It contains domains: vasomotor (items 1-3); psychosocial (items 4-10); physical (items 11-26); sexual (items 27-29); in addition to nausea and indigestion. 31 individual symptoms are rated on a scale of 0 (not at all bothered) to 6 (extremely bothered). Total possible score ranged from 0 to 186. MenQOL summary score was calculated as mean of four domain scores (Physical function, Psychosocial function, Sexual function and Vasomotor function) ranging from 1 to 8, with higher scores indicating worse quality of life.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12 and Week 16
outcome.population: The OL population included all participants who had taken at least 1 dose of open label test article. The 'n' is signifying those participants who received study drug and were evaluated for this measure at the time points for each group respectively.

group.title: DVS 100 mg
group.description: DVS 100 mg tablet taken orally daily for 15 weeks (OL phase).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Menopause-specific Quality of Life Questionnaire (MenQOL) Score at Week 4, Week 8, Week 12 and Week 16
measure.description: MenQOL questionnaire assessed how bothered participants were with 31 symptoms. It contains domains: vasomotor (items 1-3); psychosocial (items 4-10); physical (items 11-26); sexual (items 27-29); in addition to nausea and indigestion. 31 individual symptoms are rated on a scale of 0 (not at all bothered) to 6 (extremely bothered). Total possible score ranged from 0 to 186. MenQOL summary score was calculated as mean of four domain scores (Physical function, Psychosocial function, Sexual function and Vasomotor function) ranging from 1 to 8, with higher scores indicating worse quality of life.
measure.population: The OL population included all participants who had taken at least 1 dose of open label test article. The 'n' is signifying those participants who received study drug and were evaluated for this measure at the time points for each group respectively.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison was made between the difference in the means from the baseline value and post-baseline (Week 4) value with 0.
analysis.p_value_desc: The analysis was done at a significance level of alpha = 0.05, 2-sided, without any adjustments for multiple comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison was made between the difference in the means from the baseline value and post-baseline (Week 8) value with 0.
analysis.p_value_desc: The analysis was done at a significance level of alpha = 0.05, 2-sided, without any adjustments for multiple comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison was made between the difference in the means from the base value and post-baseline (Week 12) value with 0.
analysis.p_value_desc: The analysis was done at a significance level of alpha = 0.05, 2-sided, without any adjustments for multiple comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison was made between the difference in the means from the baseline value and post-baseline (Week 16) value with 0.
analysis.p_value_desc: The analysis was done at a significance level of alpha = 0.05, 2-sided, without any adjustments for multiple comparisons.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: DVS 25 mg (Titration Phase)
group.description: DVS 25 mg tablet taken orally daily for one week and placebo matched to 100 mg and 50 mg (double blind titration phase).

group.title: DVS 25/50 mg (Titration Phase)
group.description: DVS 25 mg tablet taken orally for first 4 days followed by 50 mg for next 3 days for the first week and placebo matched to 100 mg (double blind titration phase).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
